body.p: To Beriah Magoffin Governor of Ky

Your Petitioners Bernard and Henry Topmitter, would respectfully represent to your honour that, they were sentenced to the Penetentiary for one year this day. they were charged with Steeling 22 geese and they state that the geese as they believed belonged to them but owing to the instruction of the Court they were convicted of steeling them when they had no such intention wherefore they pray that they be reprieved and your Petitioners will ever pray &C,

We the undersigned Jury men who tried the case of the Commonwealth against Henry & Bernhard TopMiller respectfully join in the forgoing petition for a release or reprieve of said Topmillers as we felt from the instructions of the Court to find them guilty but we think they both ought to be reprieved this 31st day of December 1861

(Names of Jurors who tried the case
John Hambrick
John. M. Ferguson
A. H. Jameson
James Arnold
G W Dudley
L. L. O.Daniel
L. D. Croninger
H C Boswell
J B Wassen
August Droscher
Henry L Halley.
Ennis Thomas

Dear Gov. The foregoing names are the names of the Jury men that tried the case they ha asked me to draw up a petition asking the remission or their reprieve the statements in the Petition I know are true will you please attend to this at your earliest opportunity and direct to me at Covington Ky

Yours with all due respects
S. C. Perrin

Kenton Cir. Ct
Henry & Bernard Topmiller
Stealing 22 geese
21 yrs Penty
Pardon Issd Jany 17. 1862
